verses.roman:
śaṅkarānanda-sarasvatī vṛndāvana haite āilā
teṅha sei śilā-guñjā-mālā lañā gelā

synonyms: śaṅkarānanda-sarasvatī—one of the devotees of Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; vṛndāvana haite—from Vṛndāvana; āilā—came; teṅha—he; sei—that; śilā-guñjā-mālā—stone and the garland of small conchshells; lañā—taking; gelā—went.
translation: Previously, when Śaṅkarānanda Sarasvatī had returned from Vṛndāvana, he had brought the piece of stone from Govardhana Hill and also the garland of conchshells.
